steps.d: We assess access points, duct runs, and code requirements; you get a clear, fixed quote.

faq.heading: FAQ
faq.sub: Quick answers about scheduling, safety, and compliance.

items.q: How often should I clean my restaurant hood and ducts?
items.a: Frequency depends on volume and fuel type. Many jurisdictions follow NFPA 96: monthly for high‑volume (e.g., charbroiling), quarterly for moderate, semi‑annual for low. We’ll confirm your local requirements.

items.q: Do you work overnight or early mornings?
items.a: Yes. We routinely schedule during off‑hours to avoid service disruption and to allow for proper cooling and protection.
Every job includes before/after photos, a service log, and a compliance certificate you can share with insurers and fire marshals.
We use degreasers and detergents formulated for commercial kitchens and follow all label directions, PPE, and rinse procedures. HEPA filtration captures fine particulates.

story.heading: Built for busy operators
story.intro: We started Cleaning Ideas after seeing how rushed, unplanned cleanings created fire hazards and surprise downtime.
paragraphs: Our founders were technicians first. They noticed crews skipping access panels, leaving grease on rooftops, or providing no proof for insurance.
We built a process that documents every step, communicates timelines, and leaves managers confident before the next inspection.
Today, we partner with restaurants, hotels, schools, and healthcare facilities that need the job done right the first time.
